lines.text: How would you feel if you'd been dead a day and a half and someone brought your more bad news?

[after being slapped violently]
The Good Lord always says to turn the other cheek.
[Swings foot up, kicking Michellete in the groin. Michellete moans in pain]
But he never had to deal with dickheads like you.
If you keep looking at me, you'll see me kill you.

[Aims shotgun at Alex]
What are you and what are you doing here?
I don't know what I am... or where.
Maybe I died. What was it they called me?
How the hell do you eat river rat?

Well, first you gotta cut off the head and the tail, and then you gut it. Then it's all a matter of the sauce. You don't just plop down a rodent on a plate and say here's your river rat would you like red wine or white with 'em. Not that there's any wine around here anyway.

[Inebriated during a television interview]
I know someone who's trying to bring me in. Goes by the name Vacendak.
Well, I got a special message for you.
Give it up, Vacendak. You couldn't catch a cold. You couldn't catch the clap in a whorehouse!
[after watching Furlong jumping to the river]
you drink any of that, I'll be out of a job
So how do you like it here?
What is it they all want?
Why, Victor, who do you think you're talking to?
I know who I'm talking to Mark...
[Tosses Michelette's expensive Faberge Egg to him; it breaks]

[Being pinned down by gunfire]
We're trapped.
What do you mean 'we', white man?
Box him in and run him down, but be gentle... I want him WITHOUT A SCRATCH.

[Discussing the future of their relationship]
What about us?
It's two days for me. Two days, Julie.
Man, if it's come down to this. What's the point?

"What's the point?" Have you ever seen an eagle flying back to his home with dinner for the Mrs. and all the little eagle babies. And he's flying against the wind and he's flying in the rain and he's flying through bullets and all kinds of hell, and then right at that moment when he's about to get back to his nest, he says, "What the fuck, it's a drag being an eagle" and right then two little x'es comes across his eyes just like in the old fashion cartoons. And he goes plunging down, and down and down and BAM. He's just a splatter of feathers and then we don't have the national bird of America no more. Did you ever see that?
Me Neither. Eagle's got too much self-respect. How's yours?
I wouldn't dance to it, but that's a pulse.
Sorry, Ju it either him or me.
Too bad, I got used to him, I don't make a lot friends in this bussiness.

[commenting on another failure to bring in Furlong, while both standing in a lift]
I have a feeling the client's going to be really pissed!
When I want your opinion, I'll give it you.
